definitions: relating to or arising from inertia

examples.text: high-speed centrifuges generate large inertial forces
the inertial load on the motor

shortDefinitions: relating to or arising from inertia

definitions: (of navigation or guidance) depending on internal instruments which measure a craft's acceleration and compare the calculated position with stored data.
shortDefinitions: (of navigation or guidance) depending on internal instruments which measure craft's acceleration and compare calculated position with stored data

definitions: (of a frame of reference) in which bodies continue at rest or in uniform straight motion unless acted on by a force

examples.text: the laws of physics take the same form in all inertial frames

shortDefinitions: (of frame of reference) in which bodies continue at rest or in uniform straight motion unless acted on by force
